freenet.config
Class Option<T>

java.lang.Object
  freenet.config.Option<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BooleanOption, IntOption, LongOption, ShortOption, StringArrOption, StringOption
public abstract class Option<T>
extends Object

A config option.

Method Detail

setValue

public final void setValue(String val)
                    throws InvalidConfigValueException,
                           NodeNeedRestartException
Set this option's current value to a string. Will call the callback. Does not care whether the value of the option has changed.

Throws:
InvalidConfigValueException
NodeNeedRestartException

getValueString

public final String getValueString()
Get the current value of the option as a string.

setInitialValue

public final void setInitialValue(String val)
                           throws InvalidConfigValueException
Set to a value from the config file; this is not passed on to the callback, as we expect the client-side initialization to check the value. The callback is not valid until the client calls finishedInitialization().

Throws:
InvalidConfigValueException

forceUpdate

public void forceUpdate()
                 throws InvalidConfigValueException,
                        NodeNeedRestartException
Call the callback with the current value of the option.

Throws:
InvalidConfigValueException
NodeNeedRestartException

getDataType

public Option.DataType getDataType()

getDataTypeStr

public String getDataTypeStr()

getValue

public final T getValue()
Get the current value. This is the value in use if we have finished initialization, otherwise it is the value set at startup (possibly the default).

isDefault

public boolean isDefault()
Is this option set to the default?

setDefault

public final void setDefault()
Set to the default. Don't use after completed initialization, as this does not call the callback.

getDefault

public final String getDefault()
